nodes.name: Agents have the ability to explain some eventualities
nodes.fol: (forall (a c) (if (and (agent a)(cwu c a)) (exists (e0 e e1) (and (able a e0 c)(explain' e0 a e e1)))))
nodes.english: For any agent with current world understanding c, there exist some eventualities that the agent is able to explain

nodes.name: Persons defeasibly explain eventualities
nodes.fol: (forall (a) (if (and (person a)(etc)) (exists (e e1)(explain a e e1))))
nodes.english: Defeasibly, for any person, there are eventualities that they really do explain

nodes.name: Definition of mystery
nodes.fol: (forall (e a c) (iff (and (mystery e a)(cwu c a)) (and (agent a)(eventuality e) (not (exists (e1 e0) (and (able a e0 c) (explain' e0 a e e1)))))))
nodes.english: An eventuality is a mystery for an agent if the agent is not able to explain it within their current world understanding

nodes.name: Persons have mysteries
nodes.fol: (forall (a) (if (person a) (exists (e) (mystery e a))))
nodes.english: For any person, there are eventualities that are mysteries to them

nodes.name: Agents defeasibly have goals to explain
nodes.fol: (forall (a) (if (and (agent a) (etc)) (exists (e0 e e1) (and (goal e0 a)(explain' e0 a e e1)))))
nodes.english: Defeasibly, agents have goals to explain certain eventualities

nodes.name: Eventualities can have multiple possible explanations
nodes.fol: (forall (a c) (if (and (agent a)(cwu c a)) (exists (e e1 e2 e3 e4) (and (explain' e3 a e e1)(explain' e4 a e e2) (nequal e1 e2)(possible e3 c)(possible e4 c)))))
nodes.english: For any agent, there exist eventualities that have multiple different possible explanations

nodes.name: Better explanation based on graded belief
nodes.fol: (forall (a e e1 e2 d1 d2) (if (and (agent a)(explain a e e1)(explain a e e2) (gbel a e1 d1)(gbel a e2 d2)(gt d1 d2)) (betterExplanationFor e1 e2 e a)))
nodes.english: One explanation is better than another for an agent if the agent has higher graded belief in it

nodes.name: Agents have preferred explanation domains
nodes.fol: (forall (a) (if (and (agent a)(etc)) (exists (d) (and (knowledgeDomain d) (forall (e e1 e2) (if (and (member e1 d)(not (member e2 d)) (explain a e e1)(explain a e e2)) (betterExplanationFor e1 e2 e a)))))))
nodes.english: Defeasibly, agents have preferred knowledge domains such that explanations in those domains are better than explanations outside them

nodes.name: Definition of best explanation
nodes.fol: (forall (a e e1 s) (if (and (explain a e e1)(member e1 s) (forall (e2) (if (and (member e2 s)(explain a e e2) (nequal e1 e2)) (betterExplanationFor e1 e2 e a)))) (bestExplanationFor e1 e a s)))
nodes.english: An explanation is the best in a set if it is better than all other explanations in that set

nodes.name: Best explanation causes belief in causation
nodes.fol: (forall (a e e1 e3 e4 s) (if (and (bestExplanationFor' e3 e1 e a s)(believe a e) (forall (e2) (iff (member e2 s)(explain a e e2))) (cause' e4 e1 e)(believe' e5 a e4)(etc)) (cause e3 e5)))
nodes.english: Defeasibly, if an explanation is the best among all possible explanations, this causes the agent to believe that explanation causes the explained eventuality

nodes.name: Idealized explanation process breakdown
nodes.fol: (forall (a e e1) (if (and (explain a e e1)(etc)) (exists (e2 e3 e4 e5) (and (adoptGoalToExplain' e2 a e) (generateExplanations' e3 a e s) (assessExplanations' e4 a s e) (adoptExplanation' e5 a e1 e) (before e2 e3)(before e3 e4)(before e4 e5)))))
nodes.english: Defeasibly, the explanation process involves adopting a goal, generating candidates, assessing them, and adopting the best explanation, in that temporal order

nodes.name: Definition of adoptGoalToExplain
nodes.fol: (forall (a e) (iff (adoptGoalToExplain a e) (exists (e1 e2 e3) (and (changeTo e2)(goal' e2 e3 a) (explain' e3 a e e1)))))
nodes.english: To adopt a goal to explain e is to change into a state where one has the goal of explaining e

nodes.name: Adopting explanation goal due to unpredicted events
nodes.fol: (forall (a e) (if (and (agent a)(learn a e)(not (predict a e))(etc)) (adoptGoalToExplain a e)))
nodes.english: A common reason for adopting a goal to explain something is that it had not been predicted

nodes.name: Definition of generateExplanations
nodes.fol: (forall (a e s) (iff (generateExplanations a e s) (and (thinkOf a s) (forall (e1) (if (member e1 s) (and (explain a e e1)(possible e1 c) (cwu c a)))))))
nodes.english: To generate candidate explanations is to think of a set of eventualities that possibly cause the effect, given one's current world understanding

nodes.name: Definition of assessExplanations
nodes.fol: (forall (e0 a s e) (iff (assessExplanations' e0 a s e) (forall (e2) (if (member e2 e0) (exists (e3 e4 e5 e6) (and (changeTo' e2 e3)(believe' e3 a e4) (betterExplanationFor' e4 e5 e6 e a)))))))
nodes.english: To assess candidate explanations is to determine among various pairs which ones are better through belief formation about comparative quality

nodes.name: Definition of adoptExplanation
nodes.fol: (forall (a e1 e) (iff (adoptExplanation a e1 e) (exists (e2 e3) (and (changeTo e2)(believe' e2 a e3) (cause' e3 e1 e)))))
nodes.english: To adopt e1 as an explanation for e is to come to believe that e1 is the cause of e

nodes.name: Definition of rejectExplanation
nodes.fol: (forall (a e1 e) (iff (rejectExplanation a e1 e) (exists (e2 e3 e4) (and (changeTo e2)(believe' e2 a e3)(not' e3 e4) (cause' e4 e1 e)))))
nodes.english: To reject an explanation e1 for e is to change into a state where one believes that e1 does not cause e

nodes.name: Adopting explanation causes rejecting alternatives
nodes.fol: (forall (a e s e1 e2 e3) (if (and (agent a)(generateExplanations a e s) (adoptExplanation' e3 a e1 e)(member e1 s) (member e2 s)(nequal e2 e1)(etc)) (exists (e4) (and (rejectExplanation' e4 a e2 e)(cause e3 e4)))))
nodes.english: Defeasibly, adopting one explanation causes an agent to reject other explanations from the same generated set

nodes.name: Definition of explanationFailure
nodes.fol: (forall (a e) (iff (explanationFailure a e) (forall (e1 e2) (if (and (try a e2)(explain' e2 a e e1)) (fail a e2)))))
nodes.english: An explanation failure occurs exactly when every explanation attempt fails

nodes.name: Failure to generate explanations
nodes.fol: (forall (a e s) (if (and (adoptGoalToExplain a e) (generateExplanations a e s)(null s)) (explanationFailure a e)))
nodes.english: If the agent adopts the goal to explain but generates no candidate explanations, there is an explanation failure

nodes.name: Failure to assess explanations
nodes.fol: (forall (a e s) (if (and (adoptGoalToExplain a e) (generateExplanations a e s) (not (assessExplanations a s e))) (explanationFailure a e)))
nodes.english: If the agent generates candidates but does not assess them, there is an explanation failure

nodes.name: Failure to adopt explanation
nodes.fol: (forall (a e s) (if (and (adoptGoalToExplain a e) (generateExplanations a e s) (assessExplanations a s e) (not (adoptExplanation a e1 e))) (explanationFailure a e)))
nodes.english: If the agent generates and assesses candidates but does not adopt an explanation, there is an explanation failure

node_types.variable: Frequently used variables (2+ axioms in chapter)
